technology: There were no technical difficulties during the conversation.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some negative affect regarding the current state of COVID, particularly about the removal of free testing and paid sick leave (13:07-13:38).
past_neg_affect: The participant describes a very stressful and frightening experience when her son was sick and she was forced to work (02:52-05:08), and also expresses fear surrounding the vaccine rollout (06:04-06:25).
communal_orientation: The participant engages in the conversation, shares her experiences, and responds to the conversation partner's prompts, but doesn't go far beyond that to build a strong connection.
engagement: The participant is engaged in the conversation, sharing her experiences and answering questions, but not necessarily driving the conversation forward.
defensiveness: The participant does not display any defensiveness.
questions: (05:57-06:04): I'm curious, going through your minds when vaccines are rolled out.

(11:58-12:00): But did he go to the hospital at all or was it just kind of left at home or?
(12:15-12:20): Hmm. Wow. How long how long was that last for? No.

similarity_statements: (06:53-07:03): Yeah. Yeah. Well, I was so afraid. So when I got it, then I was like, oh, I think there's something happening in my leg.

vaccine_importance: The participant believes vaccines were important in the past, given the severity of the illness at the time, but is still afraid of them (14:45-14:58).
booster_importance: The participant does not believe boosters are important, given the current state of COVID (14:21-14:36).
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates a moderate amount of cognitive complexity by considering different perspectives and acknowledging the changing circumstances surrounding COVID and vaccination (12:36-12:43).
general_notes: The participant's fear surrounding the vaccine and COVID is a recurring theme throughout the conversation.
